writer_user_msg:
Instruction: Create a comprehensive report on Tokyo's seasonal weather based on the provided evidence. 

The report should include:
1. An introduction stating that Tokyo has four distinct seasons.
2. A section for each season (Spring, Summer, Autumn, Winter) detailing:
   - Typical temperature ranges (Highs/Lows in Celsius).
   - Precipitation patterns and humidity levels.
   - Key seasonal highlights (e.g., cherry blossoms in Spring, rainy season/typhoons in Summer, foliage in Autumn, snow likelihood in Winter).
3. A compact comparison table at the end summarizing High/Low Temps, Precipitation, and Humidity for all four seasons.

Use the following data points:
- Spring: Highs 15-22C, Lows 7-14C; Precip 110-140mm; Humidity 55-65%; Cherry blossoms late March/early April.
- Summer: Highs 28-33C, Lows 22-26C; Precip 150-210mm; Humidity 70-85%; Rainy season early summer, typhoons later.
- Autumn: Highs 18-26C, Lows 10-18C; Precip 120-170mm; Humidity 55-70%; Foliage peaks in November.
- Winter: Highs 8-12C, Lows 1-5C; Precip 40-70mm; Humidity 45-60%; Snow is infrequent.

Cite the sources as provided in the evidence summary.

orchestrator.research_plan:
Goal: Compare the weather in Tokyo during all seasons of the year.
1) Summarize typical temperatures by season (highs/lows).
2) Summarize precipitation and humidity by season.
3) Mention notable seasonal notes (e.g., cherry blossoms, rainy season, foliage, snow likelihood).
4) Provide a compact comparison table.
Stop after you have enough evidence to write the report.

items.title: tokyo-spring
items.summary: Spring is mild. Average highs 15-22C, lows 7-14C. Typical precipitation: 110-140 mm/month. Humidity is moderate (55-65%). Seasonal note: cherry blossom season typically peaks in late March to early April.
items.content:
# Tokyo Spring Weather
Spring is mild. Average highs 15-22C, lows 7-14C.

Typical precipitation: 110-140 mm/month. Humidity is moderate (55-65%).

Seasonal note: cherry blossom season typically peaks in late March to early April.

items.title: tokyo-summer
items.summary: Summer is hot and humid. Average highs 28-33C, lows 22-26C. Typical precipitation: 150-210 mm/month. Humidity is high (70-85%). Seasonal note: rainy season typically occurs in early summer; typhoons can occur later in summer.
items.content:
# Tokyo Summer Weather
Summer is hot and humid. Average highs 28-33C, lows 22-26C.

Typical precipitation: 150-210 mm/month. Humidity is high (70-85%).

Seasonal note: rainy season typically occurs in early summer; typhoons can occur later in summer.

items.title: tokyo-autumn
items.summary: Autumn is cooler and comfortable. Average highs 18-26C, lows 10-18C. Typical precipitation: 120-170 mm/month, generally lower than summer. Humidity 55-70%. Seasonal note: autumn foliage typically peaks in November.
items.content:
# Tokyo Autumn Weather
Autumn is cooler and comfortable. Average highs 18-26C, lows 10-18C.

Typical precipitation: 120-170 mm/month, generally lower than summer. Humidity 55-70%.

Seasonal note: autumn foliage typically peaks in November.

items.title: tokyo-winter
items.summary: Winter is cool and relatively dry. Average highs 8-12C, lows 1-5C. Typical precipitation: 40-70 mm/month. Humidity 45-60%. Snow is infrequent but possible.
items.content:
# Tokyo Winter Weather
Winter is cool and relatively dry. Average highs 8-12C, lows 1-5C.

Typical precipitation: 40-70 mm/month. Humidity 45-60%.

Snow is infrequent but possible.

plan:
Goal: Compare the weather in Tokyo during all seasons of the year.
1) Summarize typical temperatures by season (highs/lows).
2) Summarize precipitation and humidity by season.
3) Mention notable seasonal notes (e.g., cherry blossoms, rainy season, foliage, snow likelihood).
4) Provide a compact comparison table.

research_prompts:
Research typical weather patterns in Tokyo, Japan across all four seasons (Spring, Summer, Autumn, Winter). 
For each season, provide:
- Average high and low temperatures (Celsius and Fahrenheit).
- Average monthly precipitation levels and number of rainy days.
- Average humidity levels.
- Specific timing for the rainy season (Tsuyu) and typhoon season.
- Likelihood of snow in winter.
Please provide data from reliable sources like the Japan Meteorological Agency or similar climate databases.
